texts.text: The new semester has begun.
As soon as I arrived, I received a thorough reprimand from my manager in the faculty room.
But since he's had the summer break to cool off, his rebuke isn't so severe.
In the end, the whole thing was resolved with an earnest apology; no need for a formal reprimand, thankfully.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Well, at least you got off easy.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Sorry for worrying you.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: You sure did, heh.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: So, what floor?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: First. Got a group of second years.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Oh, I'm on the second floor. See you at lunch break.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Sure.
Strangely enough, the second year group I have for my first lecture happens to be Rin's group.
I take a deep breath before entering the classroom.
I've gotta act normal when I see her.
I can't let anything show on my face.
This is neither fun nor thrilling.
If I'm not careful, I could ruin her life.
I steel myself and enter the classroom.
But her seat is empty.
Is she late? Did she feel bad after I left?
Trying not to let how much the vacant seat affects me show, I begin the lecture.
Lunch break.
I don't find Rin at her usual spot in the cafeteria either.
I wonder whether I should message her or not.
There's the chance someone might have seen us interacting on campus.
But she didn't say anything when I left home this morning.
Was she in an accident?
Did she excuse herself early?
I vaguely watch the smoke rise, my thoughts occupied completely by Rin.
And then...
The wooden door of the smoking area creaks as Watanabe slams it open in a hurry.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Did you hear?!

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What's the hurry, man?
He sits next to me, huffing and out of breath.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I heard something in the faculty room just now.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: More rumors about someone's love life?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Not exactly. It's about a second-year student.
Keeping my expression neutral, I turn to Watanabe.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I heard Hatano Rin dropped out today.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: You know anything about that?
Dropped out?
Rin?
But why?
Why didn't she tell me anything?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Uh?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm sorry, Watanabe.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I need to go.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Wait, what? Why?!

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Tell the manager I'm leaving early.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Wha?! Wait aâ€”
It must be bizarre to see someone my age just run off like that.
I have a bad feeling.
What's wrong?
What the hell is going on?
Is Rin safe?
Did she really drop out of the academy? Was it her who told the faculty?
I don't even bother to pick up my things. I run to the main gate, flag down a taxi, and give the driver the location of Rin's apartment.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Rin!
I run up to the living room, but find no one.
She isn't in the bedroom, or the study, or what used to be Shuho's room.
I let my exhausted self slump onto a chair in the living room.
That's when I notice a white envelope on the desk and a sheaf of A4 copy paper.
The envelope reads "Professor."
A feeling of doom assails me.
I realize instantly that there's nothing good in that letter.
I slowly reach out and open it.
The letter is way shorter than I expected.
Professor.
If this keeps going any longer, I'll steal your whole life from you.
I don't want to ruin someone's life again. I can't bear the thought of taking everything from you.
I'm sorry.
I lied to you. Just once.
I did write my story.
I wrote about my mother.
But in the end, I never had the courage to let you read it in front of me.
So this is goodbye.
You're stronger now.
You'll be fine.
I will love you, forever and ever.
Our summer together is my most precious, irreplaceable memory. No matter what happens, I'll never forget it.
But you should forget it.
I'll remember for the both of us, so please forget about me and live on.
Always yours, Hatano Rin.
That's all she wrote.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What the hell?
I read the letter again and again.
And then, something in the text clicks.
I don't want to ruin someone's life again. I can't bear the thought of taking everything from you.
Again? Then there must have been a first time, which means...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: The first time was... Shuho?
She still thinks that it's her fault that Shuho didn't want to get married? Does she think that her mere existence is what ruined her dad's life?
And if this is the second time, she must be talking about me.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Ruin my life? How could she ever do that?
And...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: She wrote about her mother?
I pick up the stack of papers.
It's a manuscript written by her.
The title simply reads "Mother."
From all of this, I can only deduce one thing.
Suddenly, the first time we made love flashes across my mind.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: She's pregnant...?
If that's the case...
I need to find her as soon as possible.
She may be...
Trying to do something about it on her own.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Why didn't you talk to me?
I spit out the words, unable to contain the rush of emotion.
Just then, my phone rings.
Thinking it might be Rin, I hurry to pick it up.
But it's a call from Watanabe.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Arishima? Thank goodness, you actually picked up this time.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Where are you, man?! You left your bag in the faculty and all. I told them you had a medical emergency.
I try to think while Watanabe talks.
No, I have no time to think.
The only thing I know for sure is that Rin has gone away somewhere.
If there are clues to be found, they must be in this house.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Can you come meet me? I'll give you the address.
I tell him the address of the apartment complex.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: This is a giant emergency, the biggest I've ever had. Please help me.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Huh? I don't really get what's going on, but I just gotta go there, right? Uh, I don't think I'll remember the place from memory. Can you message me the address?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: All right.
Watanabe arrives at the entrance about thirty minutes later.
During that time I search the room but find nothing of use.
On the way from the entrance of the complex to the apartment, I explain the situation to Watanabe as quickly as I can.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Is this seriously Hatano Rin's home?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: And you were living here all summer? Together with her?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'll let you chew me out on ethics later if you want, but right now I need to find Rin. As soon as possible.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: She may be pregnant.
Watanabe freezes on the spot.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Oh, brother...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I think she may be trying to abort.
Watanabe chokes out a little gasp.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'll respect whatever she decides to do, but I at least want to have the chance to tell her how I feel about it.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I need to tell her that I'd like her to have the baby.
Eyes wide open, Watanabe stares right at me and sighs.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Haah... Okay.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: But you seriously have to give me the whole story later. From start to finish, all the details.
I give him a quick nod in response.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Let me think... Oh, you were living here, right? Show me your phone.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Huh?
I give him my phone immediately.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Ah, we're in luck, it's connected to the wi-fi network. You know the password?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Oh, did she set it up for you? Hmm...

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Do you know where the wi-fi router is?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Router? I don't really know?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Let's see...
Watanabe scans the living room wall.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Ah, there it is. There should be a bunch of letters and numbers written on the back of that box over there. Can you read them out for me?
Watanabe says, as he sits down and pulls a laptop out of his bag.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: There we go. The search history's stored on the router.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What are you doing?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Okay, so simply put, I can see the records of whatever sites were visited using this network.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Okay?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Mmh... What's this? Wonder why she looked up so many tutorials about preparing horse mackerel.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Probably has nothing to do with this. Can you check more recent stuff?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Okay. Hmm, it looks like she visited the website of a maternity clinic last week.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: This one.
Watanabe shows the clinic's website to me.
He opens the page about the institution.
A line on the site makes the alarms in my head go off.
To maintain confidentiality, this clinic does not require patients to register with us in order to receive treatment.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Rin...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Shinjuku!

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Wait, man. You gotta calm down.
Watanabe returns to the search history screen.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Looks like she checked out a bunch of properties after that.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What do you mean?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Shinjuku, Nikotama, Higashi-Koganei, Tokorozawa, Odawara, Atami...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But why?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: This is just my hunch here, but maybe she wants to have the baby?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Don't you think she may be looking for a place to live where she won't run into you?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: She was looking at weekly apartments too.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Damn it. It was that day?
I told her a lot of stuff after my day dealing with real estate agents.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: And the last thing she looked up was...

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Websites of maternity clinics in the Atami area.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: How are you doing all this?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I'm not doing magic over here. Anyone that knows their way around a computer can do this kind of stuff.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: The fact you two are a little clueless about tech makes this easier.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: So, what are you gonna do?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Can you give me the info of those maternity clinics in Atami that she was looking it?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Okay. There's three of them.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Send them all. I'll wait.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Sure. All of them open up at 9 a.m. tomorrow. You can make it on the first train.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: No, I'm going now. Maybe I can find her nearby.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Geez, what even is your life right now?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: It's like a damn soap opera.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Thanks for all the help. You're a real lifesaver.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Yeah, yeah. But you better call in to the faculty yourself tomorrow. You can make up excuses on your own.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'll do it if I remember. You know, I think I might just quit.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Yeah, I figured.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: The smoking area will be lonely without you.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'll call you.
I flag down a taxi and get in.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Be well, boss.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Boss?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: We'll, you're not a professor anymore, and you're going for your princess. That's a boss move, if I've ever seen one.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Oh, stop it.
Watanabe cackles and waves me off.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Give Hatano my regards.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Will do.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Thank you for everything, really.
I close the door and the taxi's engine revs up.
I look out the window from my back seat.
All the streets I walked with Rin pass by.
Rin...
You haven't stolen my life.
You're the one who gave it to me.
Please...
Don't let me be too late.
While I'm on the train, I use my phone to make a reservation at a business hotel in Atami.
Once I arrive, I check out the addresses of the clinics that Watanabe gave me.
All of them are already closed for the day.
Even if they were open, I doubt any of them would give me Rin's information if I asked.
And it'll only make it harder to find Rin if I make myself look suspicious.
After confirming the locations, I head to the hotel.
By the time I check in, I finally feel a little more calm.
I take off my jacket and sit at the small desk in my room.
It's so cramped that the chair touches the bed when I pull it to sit.
Sitting on the hard, wooden chair, I try reading Rin's novel.
Even the woman who left me made the decision to give birth to me.
It took me too long to realize something so obvious.
Can I become a mother?
Should I become someone's mother?
It wasn't until these questions occupied my mind that I started to think about how my own mother, the woman I hated so much, might have felt.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: A mother...
Losing track of the time entirely, I keep reading her novel.
Despite the urgency of the situation, I'm unable to keep from admiring her writing.
Her words cast a spell over me.
There is something in her prose that moves the heart.
Despite myself, I smile.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Damn... You're too much, Rin...
I feel like she has breathed life into me once again.
My worries about an abortion...
About her running off on her own and doing something she might regret later...
They're all gone now.
Because...
This novel clearly depicts Rin's feelings as she decides to become a mother.
The person who wrote this wasn't desperate.
It's made to reassure the reader and give them peace.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You wrote this for me...
I mutter to myself in the empty room.
Rin knows my weaknesses better than anyone.
She doesn't want me to blame myself.
She wanted our summer together to remain a precious memory.
Rin's compassion toward me reminds me of a mother's love.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You'll make a great mother, Rin...
I open the curtain and look down at the port town facing Sagami Bay.
Is Rin under one of these sparse lights dotting the streets?
After looking over Atami's cityscape, I sit down again and reread Rin's novel from the start.
The next day...
I'm keeping a close eye from afar on the entrance of the second maternity clinic that Watanabe pointed me to.
Just as the sun begins to set...
Out of the corner of my eye, I see Rin.
My heart almost jumps out of my mouth.
She's wearing the T-shirt I bought for her in Sakuragicho.
She moves like she's just another face in the crowd.
I get up hurriedly and run toward her.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Rin!
The people around throw glances my way.
Ignoring them, I keep on calling her name.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Why...?
She's completely stunned.
By the time I'm in front of her, I'm all out of breath.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: ...I'm sorry.
With my shoulders heaving and my breath ragged, I apologize.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: What? Why are you apologizing?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: ...It's mine, isn't it?
She stares at me in silence.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: ...... How did you find out about this place?
Despite the short distance, that little run took a whole lot out of me.
I rest my hands on my knees and regain my breath.
Rin stands still in front of me, just waiting.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm sorry. I kind of let Watanabe into your house.
Her eyes widen again.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: He found your internet search history using some kind of doohickey that was on the wall.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Does that mean Professor Watanabe knows about...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It doesn't matter. The jig is up. I'm quitting my job anyway.
Still a little shaken up, I straighten myself out and face her.
She's still frozen in place.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm sorry for not noticing.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: No, you didn't do anything wrong.
Rin's voice is shaky as she struggles to speak.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Didn't I tell you to forget? I wrote it all there...
She says, on the verge of breaking down into tears.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You didn't get an abortion, did you?
She looks up at me.
Her eyes swim with unshed tears.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It's your life, and I'll respect whatever decision you come to, but...
She looks up at me, her gaze unwavering.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'd like you to have the baby.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: If you want to have the baby, then I want you to go ahead with it. I'll do whatever I can to support you.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But your life...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I thought I was gonna ruin it, that's why I...
I watch as the tears begin rolling down her face.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I thought about aborting it, but...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I just couldn't, because...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It's our baby. It's not their fault. They don't know anything yet.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm glad. I'm so glad you didn't do it.
I walk up to Rin and take her into my arms.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm sorry you felt forced into doing this. I should have realized. I'm sure you already know this, but I suck at being an adult.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'll move here with you. I'm quitting my job. I'll look for something new here.
Rin shakes her head.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: No, you can't.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I made love to you knowing this could happen.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Just like you've decided to have this baby, I'll decide what to do with myself from now on.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Besides, I really hated that stupid job.
I hold her closer and stroke her head.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Let's get married. Let's meet this little baby as husband and wife.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Professor?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Do you think I can become a good mother?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I mean, I'm so young, I...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You're not gonna be raising this child alone.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Besides, they're the one who's going to make you into a mom as soon as they're born.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: No one else can do that.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But you'll be a good parent. I could bet my life on that.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: At least, that's the impression I get after reading your debut work.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: ...Thanks.
She timidly wraps her arms around me and holds me back.
I can feel her warmth again, and it's never felt better.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'll get ready to become a dad too.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Are you sure?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Is this really what you want?
I nod in response.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Today...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: This is the happiest day of my life.
I feel warmth spread within me, steady and strong. It's my love for Rin, growing stronger and renewed.
I made the woman I love feel so sad. I make a solemn promise in my mind never to make that same mistake again.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I won't leave you alone ever again.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Mhm...
We hug in the middle of the street.
I won't ever forget this warmth.
I'm sure the baby will love Rin's warmth like I do.
I've no doubt in my mind.
As the usual waiter brings my coffee, the person I'm waiting for arrives.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Hey there.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Long time no see.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Atami sure looks like a nice place. Is it nice?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah. It's pretty quiet out here.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: How's the wife and kid? Holding up well?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah, and I've got you to thank for that. We're all doing well. We owe you a lot.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Yeah, you can say that again!
He laughs out loud.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: But I didn't have such a bad time that day. It was my first time searching for someone like that. Made me feel like a true detective.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Can we smoke here?
Watanabe idly pulls a pack of cigarettes from his chest pocket.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Maybe... Sorry, I stopped smoking.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: No way, Jose!

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I figured it wouldn't be good for Rin or the baby.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: You a dad or something?! Wait, you are!

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You're the same as ever.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Yeah, unlike you, my life isn't a roller coaster.
Defeated, I nod in deference.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: The book's selling like hotcakes, eh?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah, it's downright scary.
I strongly urged Rin to try and get her novel published in some form.
Her work has a universal conflict and appeal that anyone who has a mother figure can sympathize and engage with in some way.
It's a piece of literature that can appeal to pretty much everyone.
It seems like she published it on the internet.
I'm not too well versed in that kind of thing.
But it quickly caught the attention of many people, and she was contacted by at least four publishers.
Her novel was commercialized at almost record speed.
The digital edition was released first, shortly followed by the print version. It's still growing in popularity even now.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Man, I'm green with envy. You think this whole genius thing is hereditary?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: No, it's all down to her own ability and effort. She's learned a lot, and she had a story to tell.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Her story came from the unique perspective that her upbringing gave her.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Though I suppose that's what you could call talent.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Are you writing together with her?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm her editor. I give my opinion, but I don't write.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Hah...

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: But I thought you were writing again too. Are you sure you wanna hang up the jacket when you just put it back on?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: There's no other job for me. I've found my vocation as an editor.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: My wife's work is a given, but I also like reading other people's stuff.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: That's you, all right.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Now, level with me for a minute. How much are you guys earning, for real?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You really wanna know?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Damn right.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Well, after tax, I guess we'd have about 100 million left.
Watanabe's jaw drops to the floor.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Uh, is this coffee, like, super expensive?! You're paying, right?!

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Of course. What do you take me for?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Man, maybe I should write a novel myself? Nah, forget it.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: This business can be hell if you don't take it seriously.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I'm fine as a part-time teacher, thank you very much.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Think she's almost done?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah.
This cafe is right near the maternity clinic that Rin goes to.
I always wait here during her regular checkups, and before I knew it, I was already a regular.
The coffee is good, and it's a nice place.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Ah, isn't that her?
I follow Watanabe's gaze and look out the window. Rin's standing there, waiting.
She's smiling and waving at us.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Let's go.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Hey! Long time no see!

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It's nice to see you, Professor.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Haah, hearing you call me 'professor' only drives home how messed up Arishima is in the head.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Ahahah! Now, isn't that the truth.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Never gonna live this down, am I?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I don't think so. People notice the gap between us and start wondering.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: That there's some kind of story there, I mean.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: No way around it.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Have you been well?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: As fit as a fiddle. The second years are getting nervous over the upcoming exams already.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Oh, it's that time of the year, huh? Brings back memories.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Yeah. Not sure what kind of memories for you, though.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Kaoru, why don't you guys stay out and chat a little longer? He came all the way from Kanagawa, right?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Oh, don't you worry. I'm just stopping by on my way somewhere else. I'm on a weekend trip.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Oh, I see.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You're going to Shizuoka, right?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Yeah, some kind of inn where you can pick tea leaves or something.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Hmm, that sounds like a lovely time.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Alone?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: No way in hell! With a girl. We've been dating for a while now.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: A student?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I'd appreciate it if you didn't lump me in with your husband. She's an office worker.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: How wholesome.
Rin looks up at me and shoots me an affable leer.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Wholesome means different things for different people.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Sorry for calling you guys out like this while you're expecting a baby and all that.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Don't worry, I'm in my second trimester now, so I'm getting used to it. It doesn't show that much just yet, does it?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Yeah, I almost forgot and all.
Watanabe turns to me.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: No wedding ceremony, right?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Nah. You're the only one we could invite.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Heh, right.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Hahah! Well, it looks like you're cut from the same cloth. What's important is that you're happy together, I'd say.
Rin smiles proudly and nods.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I'll get going now, boss. Get in contact if you're ever around, you hear? I'll do the same.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Gotcha.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Have a nice weekend.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Will do.
Watanabe walks back to the station, waving goodbye before he slips out of view.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You have a good friend there.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah, I think he's a really good guy.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: After all, only a saint would befriend an unwholesome maniac who puts the moves on his student.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Oh, someone's mad.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Well, it's not like I can argue with the truth.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Ahahah!
We begin to walk our way back home, side by side.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: What did you two talk about?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Just small talk. About work and stuff.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: He asked if I was sure I didn't want to keep writing.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I bet he remembers how big of a deal it was for me when I first wrote something for you to read.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I see. I think the same, though. You should write. I wanna read your stories again.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm not so sure. I don't think I'm one of the chosen ones.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: My life's full of stuff more important than writing anyway. Even I can see the writing on the wall.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: More important than writing?
I nod.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Like spending time together and supporting your writing career.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: My life has never felt more fulfilling, and I'd rather not waste any of the time I could spend with you on writing.
Rin looks up at me and positively beams.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Our baby...
She puts her hand over the little bump of her stomach.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I hope we can give them as happy a life as yours is right now.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Let's be good parents. Together.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yes.
